articles.title: Revisiting Thomas Lynch and American Funerals
articles.description: This week, Scott Simon reviews the poet Thomas Lynch’s collection of essays “The Depositions.” In 1997, Susan Jacoby wrote for the Book Review about “The Undertaking,” Lynch’s collection of essays about being a funeral director.
articles.content:
This week, Scott Simon reviews the poet Thomas Lynchs collection of essays The Depositions. In 1997, Susan Jacoby wrote for the Book Review about The Undertaking, Lynchs collection of essays about being a funeral director.

articles.title: A Poltergeist Who Adores Apricots and Cat-Loving A.I.
articles.description: The latest in science fiction and fantasy.
articles.content:

articles.author: Maria Russo
articles.title: New in Paperback: ‘The Life of Saul Bellow’ and ‘The Shades’
articles.description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
articles.content: THE LIFE OF SAUL BELLOW: Love and Strife, 1965-2005, by Zachary Leader. (Vintage, $22.) This second volume of Leaders biography begins with Bellows ascent to best-sellerdom with Herzog, balancing discussions of the authors work and personal life. In these pag… [+1311 chars]

articles.title: What’s a Best Book? And What Isn’t?
articles.description: Readers respond to recent issues of the Sunday Book Review.
articles.content:

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: ‘Mame,’ ‘Hello, Dolly!’ Composer Jerry Herman Dies at 88
articles.description: Tony Award-winning composer Jerry Herman, who wrote the cheerful, good-natured music and lyrics for such classic shows as "Mame," "Hello, Dolly!" and "La Cage aux Folles," died Thursday. He was 88.
articles.content:
Herman dated his intention to write musicals to the time his parents took him to "Annie Get Your Gun" and he went home and played five of Irving Berlin's songs on the piano. 
"I thought what a gift this man has given a stranger. I wanted to give that gift to… [+1856 chars]

articles.title: Blocked in U.S., Huawei Touts ‘Shared Values’ to Compete in Europe
articles.description: The Chinese tech giant is spending millions of dollars on a charm offensive in Brussels, hoping for a leading role in building 5G networks. It seems to be working.
articles.content:
No Chinese company is an independent company, Norbert Röttgen, a former government minister from Ms. Merkels party, said recently, adding that Huaweis involvement was an imminent question of national security.
